headline: Hillary Just Made a Political Move That’s Got The 2024 Rumor Mill Working Overdrive
author: Sophie O’Hara
sentences: Hillary Clinton participated in two fundraisers for then-candidates Joe Biden and Kamala Harris during the 2020 election cycle, although she was ultimately overshadowed by fundraising surrogates like Stacey Abrams and Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren.

Douglas Schoen, whose business partner served as chief political strategist on Clinton’s 2008 presidential campaign, argued in a Wall Street Journal op-ed that the former New York senator could serve as a moderate alternative during the 2024 primaries.

MORE NEWS: [VIDEO] Donna Brazile Goes on ABC and Tries to “Help” Joe But Ends Up Making Everything Worse
Crooked Hillary is returning to political fundraising for the first time since 2020… something many thought she wouldn’t do again.

Well, it’s been quite a while since we’ve seen Hillary Clinton hit the political scene, but considering the fact that it’s definitely slim pickings in the Dem arena, it’s really no surprise that she’s come slithering back.

She’s now dipping her cloven hooves into the political waters again, and that can only mean one thing…
Hillary is likely running or seriously thinking about it- and that’s why she’s now inserting herself back in the game.

Hillary Clinton’s continued interest in party politics is “about being relevant and people seeing [her and Bill] as a net positive, not a net negative,” a former campaign bundler for the Clintons reportedly told Politico.
Former White House adviser and current Newsmax contributor Dick Morris claimed that there is a “good chance” that the 2024 presidential election will feature a Clinton-Donald Trump rematch.
There’s literally nothing new these people are bringing to the table, they just keep bringing back the same old, washed-up career politicians they’ve been using for the past three decades.
This move, along with her comments condemning far-left members of her party, has fueled more speculation that we could see likely Hillary running for president yet again in 2024.
Rob Portman, although he does face a left-wing primary opponent in former Consumer Financial Protection Bureau employee Morgan Harper.
The Daily Caller reported that the fundraising event, which will be held on Zoom, was first announced by the Ryan campaign Jan. 18.
Bill Clinton hosted a fundraiser in August 2021 for Virginia gubernatorial candidate and longtime ally Terry McAuliffe.
Both Hillary and Bill Clinton are reportedly looking forward to playing a renewed role in Democratic Party politics.
Several former Clinton advisers have suggested that Hillary Clinton would consider a 2024 presidential run.
Hillary is now campaigning for her buddy and failed running mate Tim Ryan, at a $2,900 per-head price tag.
The minimum donation for admission is $2,900, and donors can become event co-chairs for $20,800.
Ryan is the presumptive Democratic nominee in the race to succeed retiring Republican Sen.
McAuliffe chaired Hillary Clinton’s 2008 presidential campaign.
Hillary was supposed to go bye-bye…but she’s baaaacccck.

Good grief…
How much more stale can the Democrats get?
The “Queen” still feels she deserves her throne.
She smells an opportunity.
